todos.title: Remove leaves from gutters and downspouts
todos.description: Clear away accumulated leaves from gutters and downspouts to prevent water damage and maintain proper drainage.

todos.title: Sweep walkways and patios
todos.description: Clear walkways and patios of debris, fallen leaves, and dirt to maintain a clean and inviting outdoor space.

todos.title: Trim overgrown plants and shrubs
todos.description: Shape and maintain overgrown plants and shrubs to enhance the appearance of the garden and prevent them from becoming unruly.

todos.title: Remove weeds from flower beds and garden areas
todos.description: Eliminate weeds from flower beds, garden areas, and around plants to prevent competition for nutrients and water.

todos.title: Clean and disinfect garden tools and equipment
todos.description: Clean and disinfect garden tools and equipment to prevent the spread of diseases and pests, and extend the lifespan of tools.

todos.title: Remove debris and clutter from garden areas
todos.description: Clear away debris, fallen branches, and clutter from garden areas to maintain a neat and organized appearance.

todos.title: Dispose of garden waste properly
todos.description: Collect and dispose of garden waste, such as leaves, clippings, and weeds, in a responsible manner to maintain a tidy environment.

todos.title: Check and repair garden fences and structures
todos.description: Inspect garden fences, trellises, and other structures for damage or wear and tear, and make necessary repairs to maintain safety and aesthetic appeal.

todos.title: Empty and clean compost bins
todos.description: Empty and clean compost bins regularly to maintain proper decomposition and prevent the accumulation of pests and unpleasant odors.

todos.title: Document and plan for seasonal garden maintenance tasks
todos.description: Maintain a record of completed garden

todos.title: Water plants and monitor their health
todos.description: Provide adequate water to plants, taking into account "their specific needs" and "weather conditions", and regularly check for signs of stress or disease.

todos.title: Fertilize plants as needed
todos.description: Apply fertilizer to plants according to "their specific requirements" and "growth stages" to promote healthy growth and vibrant blooms.

todos.title: Deadhead spent flowers
todos.description: Remove spent flowers from plants to encourage continued blooming, enhance "the overall appearance" of the garden, and prevent seed formation.

todos.title: Mulch around plants to conserve moisture and suppress weeds
todos.description: Apply a layer of mulch around plants to retain moisture, reduce evaporation, suppress weed growth, and maintain "a neat and tidy garden bed".

todos.title: Inspect plants for signs of pests and diseases
todos.description: Regularly inspect plants for signs of pests, such as insects or mites, and diseases, such as discoloration or wilting, to take timely action to protect "the garden's health".

todos.title: Prune plants to maintain their shape and promote growth
todos.description: Prune plants selectively to remove dead or diseased branches, control size and shape, encourage new growth, and enhance "the overall appearance" of the garden.

todos.title: Protect plants from harsh weather conditions
todos.description: Take appropriate measures to protect plants from extreme temperatures, strong winds, or excessive rainfall, such as covering them with frost blankets or providing windbreaks.

todos.title: Clean and organize garden tools and equipment storage area
todos.description: Maintain a clean and organized storage area for garden tools and equipment to prevent damage, extend "their lifespan", and ensure easy access when needed.
